image.guidance: Upload an image file (PNG, JPG, SVG) of an Entity Relationship Diagram. The ERD should show how the different tables relate to one another for example via foreignID keys. Max file size: 5MB.

description.guidance: Short textual description of the ERD

examples: Linked multi-omic dataset in oesophageal cancer (OCCAMS)
Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) real-world dataset
title.guidance: - Use the **title** the dataset is best known by. Expand **acronyms**, adding the acronym in brackets.\n- Use a **unique** title. adding a **prefix** with your organisation name or identifier where necessary

abstract.description: Optimal length one paragraph. Limited to 255 characters. Avoid long sentences and abbreviations.
examples: Anonymised real-world clinical data from patients with advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer.  Data includes treatments, imaging, long-term follow up and outcomes. Database size = 774 in 2025 + 150 patients/year.
abstract.guidance: - A **clear and brief descriptive signpost** for researchers, summarising the dataset's scope and contents.\n- The first line of the abstract is visible to readers when searching for datasets.\n- **Abstracts should be different from the full description** for a dataset.

dataCustodian.description: Organisation responsible for queries and data access requests.

keywords.description: If not included in abstract, title or filters, please provide one or more keywords or short phrases to improve search engine optimisation.
keywords.guidance: - Keywords need not repeat information provided in the title, abstract or filters.\n - If needed they should refer to specific additional details of the dataset.\n - Include one per line.

contactPoint.description: Email address for coodinating data access requests.
contactPoint.guidance: This should be a **dedicated email address** associated with the data access request process. \n**Note:** An employee's email address can only be provided on a temporary basis and if one is provided, **you must obtain explicit consent for this purpose**.

examples: OPTIMAM is a database of mammogram images and associated clinical data from multiple NHS Breast Cancer screening sites across the UK. The automated process of image collection, processing and storage enables easy expansion across new imaging sites and continual collection of new data.

associatedMedia.description: Url linking to associated media. Note: media asset can be hosted by the organisation or uploaded using the onboarding portal.

syntheticDataWebLink.description: Artificial datasets that share the properties of the original data but contain no sensitive information can be very useful for researchers wishing to explore the properties of a dataset, and can be generated using entirely local solutions such as python's Synthetic Data Vault. Please provide the website address(es) with information on any related synthetic datasets. For example: https://digital.nhs.uk/ndrs/data/data-outputs/cancer-publications-and-tools/simulacrum

version.guidance:
Dataset metadata version should follow standard SEMVER naming conventions (https://semver.org). For example: 1.1.0 major.minor.patch.
Major: Significant/breaking changes. 
 eg The dataset has now been populated 
 The access conditions have changed 
The purpose of the dataset has changed significantly 
 There is a change to the type of datasets collected
Minor: New features and bug fixes.
 eg More samples have been added. 
Patch: Minor fixes without new features. 
eg more information about the dataset has been added
